comment: As a developer, I see huge potential in the future: with enough abstraction, OXOLO could be used to generate video tutorials to replace the STORYBOOKS of any company creating content blocks on video.
As a product marketer, I would use OHOLO every day: short videos on instragram, rils, any social network. You can reduce advertising costs by generating daily visibility of the product in the market.

As a Marathon participant, I can confirm that OXOLO exceeded all my expectations in generating videos just from the start page of the event (https://www.marathon-hannover.de/strecken/streckenverlauf.html): all important aspects are taken into account, sponsors, distances. This video really SELLS. As a member of the Achilles group (running with the invisible) I see great potential in OXOLO to attract sponsors and participants for races around the world

As a job seeker, I used OXOLO to generate a video on my LinkedIn profile. I would not recommend this product for this purpose: the generated video told more about my current job than about me as a job seeker

I'd like consistency. Even though the site is not a product, a few things catch my eye. For example, I didn't align the buttons in the header. Isn't that noticeable? Some text is not capitalised, many buttons are not centred (used padding instead of align - eg. User profile)

Different parts of the site have different user interfaces and it's a bit distracting (in the studio, https://studio.oxolo.com/studio-home the drop-down menu looks different than the video creation https://www.oxolo.com/solutions/video-creator/). From the user's point of view it's one product and the interface should be similar
